channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report X-2024010308
item.description:
Report X-2024010308

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-24
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG FOUND IN UNLOAD DAMAGED WITH INTERNAL LEAKAGE DUE TO CONTENTS BEING CRACKED. DescribePack: CRACKED BOTTOM DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG AND CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN HAZ BAG AND HAZ TOTE

item.title: Report E-2024010102
item.description:
Report E-2024010102

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 4 gallons of Rnew (un3098) released from a 5 gallon pail due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Basin estimates that 4 gallons of product was released due to a nail puncture. Basin has been advised that vented bung cap will be required on the poly waste drum. (1) 55-gallon vented poly drum of waste was created and left at the terminal.
